hash: add HashedSourceWriter

This class is the counterpart to CHashVerifier, in that it
writes data to an underlying source stream,
while keeping a hash of the written data.

Github-Pull: #26909
Rebased-From: da6c7aeca38e1d0ab5839a374c26af0504d603fc

verification.payload:
tree dff51790d822782ab00825f7370b9b2fa3c981e7
parent fd94befbc62e5f6b93f87979cc2011508378043d
author Martin Zumsande <mzumsande@gmail.com> 1673637145 -0500
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1674141219 +0000

addrdb: Only call Serialize() once

The previous logic would call it once for serializing into the filestream,
and then again for serializing into the hasher. If AddrMan was changed
in between these calls by another thread, the resulting peers.dat would
be corrupt with non-matching checksum and data.
Fix this by using HashedSourceWriter, which writes the data
to the underlying stream and keeps track of the hash in one go.

Github-Pull: #26909
Rebased-From: 5eabb61b2386d00e93e6bbb2f493a56d1b326ad9

events.message:
addrdb: Only call Serialize() once

The previous logic would call it once for serializing into the filestream,
and then again for serializing into the hasher. If AddrMan was changed
in between these calls by another thread, the resulting peers.dat would
be corrupt with non-matching checksum and data.
Fix this by using HashedSourceWriter, which writes the data
to the underlying stream and keeps track of the hash in one go.

issue.title: refactor: Add missing includes to fix gcc-13 compile error
issue.body:
On current master:

```
  CXX      support/libbitcoin_util_a-lockedpool.o
support/lockedpool.cpp: In member function â€˜void Arena::free(void*)â€™:
support/lockedpool.cpp:99:20: error: â€˜runtime_errorâ€™ is not a member of â€˜stdâ€™
   99 |         throw std::runtime_error("Arena: invalid or double free");
      |                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
support/lockedpool.cpp:22:1: note: â€˜std::runtime_errorâ€™ is defined in header â€˜<stdexcept>â€™; did you forget to â€˜#include <stdexcept>â€™?
   21 | #include <algorithm>
  +++ |+#include <stdexcept>
   22 | #ifdef ARENA_DEBUG
support/lockedpool.cpp: In member function â€˜void LockedPool::free(void*)â€™:
support/lockedpool.cpp:320:16: error: â€˜runtime_errorâ€™ is not a member of â€˜stdâ€™
  320 |     throw std::runtime_error("LockedPool: invalid address not pointing to any arena");
      |                ^~~~~~~~~~~~~
support/lockedpool.cpp:320:16: note: â€˜std::runtime_errorâ€™ is defined in header â€˜<stdexcept>â€™; did you forget to â€˜#include <stdexcept>â€™?

Additional include fixes are required to make the 23.x branch compile
using GCC 13.

events.message:
23.x Add missing includes to fix gcc-13 compile error

Additional include fixes are required to make the 23.x branch compile
using GCC 13.

events.body: Compiling 23.x (398768769f85cc1b6ff212ed931646b59fa1acd6) with GCC 13 requires additional include fixes to what is already backported, so I've added a commit with them.
